title: Mundari (1961) Genesis Portion
description: Mundari is an Eastern Nilotic language spoken by the Mundari people of South Sudan. The Mundari are a small ethnic group in South Sudan. They are a part of the Karo people, one of the Nilotic peoples. The group is composed of cattle herders and agriculturalists and are part of the Karo people which also includes Bari, Pojulu, Kakwa, Kuku, and Nyangwara. Kutuk na Mundari is also the name of their language, which is similar to Kutuk na Kuku, Kutuk na Kakwa, Kutuk na Pojulu, Kutuk na Bari, and Kutuk na Nyangwara.
provider: Bible Society of India and Ceylon

language.name: Mundari
language.area: Jharkhand, south and west Ranchi District; Orissa; Madhya Pradesh; West Bengal; Himachal Pradesh; Assam; Tripura; Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Also in Bangladesh, Nepal.
